intro: Galium galiopsis, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are often covered in fine hairs, and the leaves may have a slightly hairy or glandular surface. Galium galiopsis is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils.
